result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Grimes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian Grimes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christian Grimes was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

Payments will be made in increments of $400 monthly due on the last day of every month beginning July 31, 2022. 180 days of jail time imposed and stayed for payments. Failure to make payments will result in jail time. 10 days jail for the 1st missed payment, 20 days jail for the second missed payment, 30 days jail for the third missed payment. 4th missed payment will result in remainder of jail time (120 days).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Grimes

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Defendant Christian Grimes in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Christian Grimes.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates  will plead to count 1, count 2 dismissed. Joint recommendation of a withheld sentence for 2 years probation, costs, DOC programming, restitution in the amount of $3,080. Conditional jail of 180 days stayed for payments of $400 per month toward restitution beginning next month. If 1 payment is missed, will serve 10 days, 2 payments, 20 days, 3 payments 30 days and 4 payments, remaining time to be served.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads guilty. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Any remaining charges dismissed.
State indicates no contact will continue. Cites prior history. 
Court orders sentence withheld for 2 years, costs, DOC programming, no contact with victim, restitution in the amount of $3,080, payments of $400 per month by end of month by July 31st, 180 days stayed for payments,  failure to make payment will be 10 days for 1st, 20 days for 2nd, 30 days for 3rd, 4th remainder of jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Christian Grimes
Current: 1428 E 1st Street, Apt 2, Duluth, MN 55808 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2022)
Prior: 1428 E. 1st Street, Duluth, MN 55805

9:05 AM Defendant Christian Grimes in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen appeared by video for Christian Grimes.  Attorney Chad La lor for Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Asks for a status conference 8 weeks out. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Atty Craker-client will waive the preliminary hearing;  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim 1 as listed in the ID KEy

01:41 PM Defendant Christian Grimes in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker and not in-custody.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's middle name is Dionta.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.   Defendant's address confirmed.  Not guilty plea(s) entered to misdemeanor count. Court accepts plea. State requests $500 cash bond no contact with victim 1. Prior midemeanor of violence in MN. State gives further criminal history. Atty Craker asserts the birthday on the complaint as listed 10/9 and the one listed in MN is 10/1. Mr. Grimes did appear voluntarily today. Atty states even if it is the same Christian Grimes, there is no significant criminal history. Defendant is in between jobs. State indicates that the Probation Officer in MN told the Defendant to be here today. State doesn't know about the mistaken birthdate. 
Court Orders $3500 signature bond with conditions of   No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID Key. Court reminds defendant of text message reminder.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
